item.title: 100 English Questions for Haryana CET Group Cüå≤
item.description:
100 English Questions for Haryana CET Group C

Below are 100 practice-oriented English questions frequently asked in Haryana CET Group C. The questions include grammar, vocabulary, comprehension, error spotting, and sentence improvement, tailored for the exam‚Äôs level and style.

Grammar: Tenses, Subject-Verb Agreement, Sentence Structure

  1. Choose the correct form: We ______ him since last year. a) don‚Äôt see b) didn‚Äôt see c) haven‚Äôt seen d) hadn‚Äôt seen Answer: c) haven‚Äôt seen
  2. Fill in the blank: She ______ in this office for ten years. a) works b) is working c) has been working d) worked Answer: c) has been working
  3. Identify the correct sentence: a) He don‚Äôt likes tea. b) He doesn‚Äôt likes tea. c) He doesn‚Äôt like tea. d) He not likes tea. Answer: c) He doesn‚Äôt like tea.
  4. Choose the correct verb: Either Ramesh or Suresh ______ to blame. a) are b) were c) is d) have Answer: c) is
  5. Fill in: She ______ to the market every Sunday. a) go b) went c) goes d) gone Answer: c) goes
  6. Complete the sentence: The train ______ before we reached the station. a) leaves b) has left c) had left d) leave Answer: c) had left
  7. Choose the correct tense: They ______ cricket since morning. a) play b) have played c) have been playing d) played Answer: c) have been playing
  8. Choose the correct form: Neither he nor I ______ going. a) is b) am c) are d) be Answer: b) am
  9. Which is correct? a) The cat have eaten. b) The cat has eaten. c) The cat had eat. d) The cat eats. Answer: b) The cat has eaten.
  10. Find the correct option: Everyone ______ present yesterday. a) was b) were c) are d) have Answer: a) was

Articles, Prepositions, Conjunctions

  1. Fill in the blank: She is ______ honest girl. a) a b) an c) the d) None Answer: b) an
  2. Complete the sentence: There is ______ university in the city. a) a b) an c) the d) none Answer: a) a
  3. Fill the preposition: He is fond ______ reading novels. a) of b) to c) on d) in Answer: a) of
  4. Choose the correct: He has been absent ______ Monday. a) since b) for c) from d) on Answer: a) since
  5. Fill the preposition: She divided the apple ______ two children. a) between b) among c) in d) with Answer: a) between
  6. Choose the right conjunction: ____ he was ill, he attended the meeting. a) Because b) Since c) Although d) If Answer: c) Although
  7. Complete the phrase: He walked slowly ______ he was tired. a) because b) so c) and d) but Answer: a) because
  8. Select the correct: He will come ______ you call him. a) if b) although c) unless d) because Answer: a) if
  9. Fill in the blank: This is the boy ______ I saw yesterday. a) which b) whose c) whom d) who Answer: c) whom
  10. Choose the correct preposition: I am interested ______ music. a) for b) in c) with d) at Answer: b) in

Vocabulary: Synonyms & Antonyms

  1. Choose the synonym: ‚ÄúHappy‚Äù a) Sad b) Cheerful c) Angry d) Weak Answer: b) Cheerful
  2. Antonym of ‚ÄúBroad‚Äù is: a) Wide b) Flat c) Narrow d) Deep Answer: c) Narrow
  3. Synonym of ‚ÄúBrave‚Äù is: a) Timid b) Coward c) Courageous d) Fear Answer: c) Courageous
  4. Antonym of ‚ÄúPrecise‚Äù is: a) Accurate b) Vague c) Exact d) Sharp Answer: b) Vague
  5. Synonym for ‚ÄúBegin‚Äù: a) End b) Finish c) Start d) Close Answer: c) Start
  6. Antonym of ‚ÄúAncient‚Äù: a) Old b) Modern c) Past d) Early Answer: b) Modern
  7. Synonym of ‚ÄúWealthy‚Äù: a) Poor b) Miser c) Rich d) Greedy Answer: c) Rich
  8. Antonym of ‚ÄúAdvantage‚Äù: a) Benefit b) Profit c) Loss d) Gain Answer: c) Loss
  9. Synonym of ‚ÄúRapid‚Äù: a) Slow b) Fast c) Difficult d) Late Answer: b) Fast
  10. Antonym of ‚ÄúGenerous‚Äù: a) Kind b) Selfish c) Large d) Liberal Answer: b) Selfish

One-word Substitution & Idioms

  1. One who looks on the bright side of things: a) Pessimist b) Optimist c) Realist d) Egoist Answer: b) Optimist
  2. The study of the stars is called: a) Geography b) Astrology c) Astronomy d) Biology Answer: c) Astronomy
  3. A place where books are kept: a) Gallery b) Museum c) Library d) Laboratory Answer: c) Library
  4. To call a spade a spade: a) To speak honestly b) To call wrong right c) To dig a garden d) To play games Answer: a) To speak honestly
  5. To break the ice means: a) To start a conversation b) To swim in cold water c) To win a fight d) To freeze water Answer: a) To start a conversation
  6. A person who talks too much: a) Introvert b) Extrovert c) Garrulous d) Quiet Answer: c) Garrulous
  7. A person who can use both hands equally well: a) Ambiguous b) Ambivalent c) Ambidextrous d) Amphibian Answer: c) Ambidextrous
  8. A lover of books: a) Bibliophile b) Philatelist c) Egoist d) Optimist Answer: a) Bibliophile
  9. A sentence with correct idiom: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs raining cats and dogs.‚Äù means: a) It‚Äôs very windy b) It‚Äôs raining heavily c) There are many animals outside d) It‚Äôs a sunny day Answer: b) It‚Äôs raining heavily
  10. The meaning of ‚Äúkick the bucket‚Äù is: a) To die b) To be angry c) To go on vacation d) To be happy Answer: a) To die

Error Spotting

  1. She don‚Äôt like sweets. a) No error b) don‚Äôt c) like d) sweets Answer: b) don‚Äôt (should be ‘doesn‚Äôt’)
  2. The news are good. a) The b) news c) are d) good Answer: c) are (should be ‘is’)
  3. Everyone have submitted their form. a) Everyone b) have c) submitted d) their Answer: b) have (should be ‘has’)
  4. He did not knew the answer. a) He b) did c) not d) knew Answer: d) knew (should be ‘know’)
  5. She is senior than him. a) She b) is c) senior d) than Answer: d) than (should be ’to’)
  6. Neither of the boys have completed the work. a) Neither b) of c) the boys d) have Answer: d) have (should be ‘has’)
  7. She is the best of the two girls. a) She b) is c) the best d) of the two Answer: c) the best (should be ‘better’)
  8. I am living here since 2010. a) I b) am living c) here d) since 2010 Answer: b) am living (should be ‘have been living’)
  9. The police is investigating the case. a) The b) police c) is d) investigating Answer: c) is (should be ‘are’)
  10. Mathematics are her favorite subject. a) Mathematics b) are c) her d) favorite Answer: b) are (should be ‘is’)

Sentence Improvement

  1. She do not likes apples. a) do not like b) does not like c) did not like d) no improvement Answer: b) does not like
  2. He did his work properly, isn‚Äôt he? a) is he b) wasn‚Äôt he c) doesn‚Äôt he d) didn‚Äôt he Answer: d) didn‚Äôt he
  3. The book is on the table, isn‚Äôt it? a) didn‚Äôt it b) isn‚Äôt he c) is it d) no improvement Answer: d) no improvement
  4. She has went to school. a) has go b) has gone c) had gone d) no improvement Answer: b) has gone
  5. He is more senior from me. a) than me b) to me c) over me d) no improvement Answer: b) to me
  6. I prefer coffee than tea. a) for tea b) more than tea c) to tea d) no improvement Answer: c) to tea
  7. He is good in English. a) good to English b) good for English c) good at English d) no improvement Answer: c) good at English
  8. Her mother is ill since Monday. a) was ill b) has been ill c) is ill from d) no improvement Answer: b) has been ill
  9. They discussed about the project. a) discussed of b) discussed on c) discussed d) no improvement Answer: c) discussed
  10. No sooner he had arrived than it started to rain. a) No sooner had he arrived b) No sooner he arrived c) No sooner he has arrived d) No improvement Answer: a) No sooner had he arrived

Fill in the Blanks & Cloze Test

  1. Bread and butter ______ my favorite breakfast. a) is b) are c) has d) have Answer: a) is
  2. Each of the boys ______ given a prize. a) were b) was c) are d) have Answer: b) was
  3. The children are afraid ______ the dark. a) in b) from c) of d) to Answer: c) of
  4. I will call you when I ______ home. a) reached b) will reach c) reach d) reaches Answer: c) reach
  5. My uncle ______ in Canada since 2010. a) lives b) living c) lived d) has been living Answer: d) has been living
  6. She ______ to Mumbai last year. a) go b) goes c) went d) going Answer: c) went
  7. Take care ______ your health. a) for b) of c) to d) in Answer: b) of
  8. He is junior ______ me. a) to b) than c) from d) with Answer: a) to
  9. Mohan is ______ honest man. a) a b) an c) the d) one Answer: b) an
  10. He ______ playing cricket when it started raining. a) is b) was c) has d) had Answer: b) was

Voice & Narration (Direct/Indirect Speech)

  1. Change the voice: ‚ÄúThey sell flowers.‚Äù a) Flowers are sold by them. b) Flowers were sold by them. c) Flowers are being sold by them. d) No change Answer: a) Flowers are sold by them.
  2. Change to passive voice: ‚ÄúShe is writing a letter.‚Äù a) A letter was written by her. b) A letter is written by her. c) A letter is being written by her. d) Letters are being written by her. Answer: c) A letter is being written by her.
  3. Change to Indirect Speech: He said, ‚ÄúI am going to market.‚Äù a) He said he was going to market. b) He said that he is going to market. c) He says he is going to market. d) He said that he was going to market. Answer: d) He said that he was going to market.
  4. Identify the correct sentence (passive voice): a) The thief was caught by the police. b) The thief caught the police. c) The police catches the thief. d) The thief catch the police. Answer: a) The thief was caught by the police.
  5. Change the narration: ‚ÄúShe said, ‚ÄòI will help you.‚Äô‚Äù a) She said she would help me. b) She said she help me. c) She says she will help me. d) She said that she helps me. Answer: a) She said she would help me.

Comprehension (Short Passages)

Read the passage and answer questions 76-80:

A monkey and a crocodile were friends. The monkey lived on a tree near a river. One day, the crocodile wanted to eat the monkey‚Äôs heart, so he invited him to his house. The monkey understood the plan and saved himself.

  1. Who were friends in the story? a) Monkey and Lion b) Crocodile and Dog c) Monkey and Crocodile d) Monkey and Fish Answer: c) Monkey and Crocodile
  2. Where did the monkey live? a) In the water b) On a hill c) On a tree d) Near a mountain Answer: c) On a tree
  3. What did the crocodile want? a) The monkey‚Äôs heart b) Banana c) Fish d) River Answer: a) The monkey‚Äôs heart
  4. Where was the tree located? a) On a hill b) Near a river c) In a jungle d) In a garden Answer: b) Near a river
  5. How did the monkey save himself? a) By fighting b) By running c) By being clever d) By jumping Answer: c) By being clever

Sentence Rearrangement & Completion

  1. Rearrange the parts: a) goes to work b) every morning c) Raman d) at 8 AM A proper order is: a) c b d a b) c a b d c) c d b a d) c a d b Answer: d) c a d b
  2. Which part completes the sentence: She is ______ to win the race. a) likely b) possible c) agree d) likelyly Answer: a) likely

Spellings

  1. Pick the correctly spelled word: a) Recieve b) Receive c) Recievee d) Receeve Answer: b) Receive
  2. Correct spelling for ‚Äúgovernment‚Äù: a) Goverment b) Government c) Govermant d) Govtment Answer: b) Government
  3. Pick the correct spelling: a) Necessary b) Neccessary c) Neccesary d) Necessery Answer: a) Necessary

Miscellaneous

  1. Choose the correct word: He drove ______ the tunnel. a) across b) through c) on d) by Answer: b) through
  2. Fill suitable word: She is ______ to listen. a) ready b) read c) already d) reading Answer: a) ready
  3. Select the antonym of ‚ÄúPolite‚Äù: a) Gentle b) Soft c) Rude d) Kind Answer: c) Rude
  4. Choose synonym of ‚ÄúRapid‚Äù: a) Sleepy b) Slow c) Fast d) Shy Answer: c) Fast
  5. Choose the word that fits: They ______ yesterday. a) will come b) comes c) came d) come Answer: c) came

Short Usage and Practical Application

  1. Choose the correct usage: She ______ swimming. a) like b) liked c) likes d) likes to Answer: c) likes
  2. Select proper word: The ______ are grazing in the field. a) cattle b) cattles c) catles d) cats Answer: a) cattle
  3. Identify the correct: She sings ______. a) beautiful b) beautifully c) beauty d) beautify Answer: b) beautifully
  4. Proper conjunction: He worked hard ______ he could pass. a) so that b) but c) although d) yet Answer: a) so that
  5. Select plural form: Child a) Childs b) Children c) Childes d) Childens Answer: b) Children
  6. Select the opposite of ‚ÄúStart‚Äù: a) Open b) Continue c) End d) Middle Answer: c) End
  7. Choose the right expression: This pen is superior ______ that. a) than b) to c) from d) of Answer: b) to
  8. He went to school ______ foot. a) on b) by c) with d) at Answer: a) on
  9. Select the odd pair: a) Tall ‚Äì Short b) Big ‚Äì Small c) High ‚Äì Low d) Near ‚Äì Bear Answer: d) Near ‚Äì Bear
  10. Select correct auxiliary verb: ______ you ever seen a tiger? a) Did b) Have c) Had d) Has Answer: b) Have

These questions closely mirror the Haryana CET Group C English style and level, covering all major aspects‚Äîgrammar, vocabulary, comprehension, practical usage, and key exam topics. For extensive practice, also solve previous year question papers and online mock tests.12

‚ÅÇ

  1. https://testbook.com/questions/hssc-cet-group-c-english-questions--675ab249ec3129333bf14330 ↩︎

  2. https://www.careerpower.in/hssc-cet-previous-year-question-papers.html ↩︎

item.title: 100 Reasoning Ability Questions for Haryana CET With Solutions
item.description:
100 Reasoning Ability Questions for Haryana CET With Solutions

Below, you’ll find a high-quality mix of previous year and practice reasoning questions tailored for Haryana CET Group C. Each question comes with a clear, concise solution to help you master concepts such as series, analogy, odd one out, coding-decoding, blood relations, direction sense, syllogism, statements and conclusions, order and ranking, and more.

1‚Äì20: Series Completion & Pattern Recognition

  1. Find the next number: 2, 6, 12, 20, ?
    • Solution: +4, +6, +8, ‚Ä¶ Next is +10 ‚áí 20+10=30
  2. 5, 11, 23, 47, ?
    • Solution: Each √ó2+1: 5√ó2+1=11, 11√ó2+1=23‚Ä¶ So, 47√ó2+1=95
  3. Fill the blank: A, C, F, J, O, ?
    • Solution: +2, +3, +4, +5‚Ä¶ So, O (15)+6=21 ‚áí 21st letter = U
  4. 3, 8, 15, 24, ?
    • Solution: +5, +7, +9, ‚Ä¶ Next is +11 ‚áí 24+11=35
  5. 2, 4, 8, 16, ?
    • Solution: √ó2 each step ‚áí 16√ó2=32
  6. 23, 20, 17, __, 11
    • Solution: ‚Äì3 each time. Next: 17‚Äì3=14
  7. Z, X, V, T, ?
    • Solution: Letters: every alternate in reverse. Next = R
  8. 9, 16, 25, 36, ?
    • Solution: Square numbers. Next: 7¬≤=49
  9. J, L, O, S, ?
    • Solution: +2, +3, +4… S +5=X
  10. 2, 3, 5, 8, 12, ?
    • Solution: +1, +2, +3, +4… Last: 12+5=17
  11. 6, 11, 21, 41, ?
    • Solution: √ó2-1: 6√ó2‚Äì1=11, etc. Next: 41√ó2‚Äì1=81
  12. 100, 81, 64, ?
    • Solution: 10¬≤, 9¬≤, 8¬≤‚Ä¶ Next 7¬≤ = 49
  13. 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, ?
    • Solution: Squares: Next 36
  14. 16, 8, 4, ?
    • Solution: √∑2: Next 2
  15. 3, 6, 9, 15, 24, ?
    • Solution: +3, +3, +6, +9‚Ä¶ Next: 24+15=39
  16. 100, 50, 25, ?
    • Solution: √∑2: Next is 12.5
  17. 1, 3, 6, 10, ?
    • Solution: Add 2, 3, 4… Next: 10+5=15
  18. K, J, H, E, ?
    • Solution: ‚Äì1, ‚Äì2, ‚Äì3… E‚Äì4=B
  19. 12, 23, 34, 45, ?
    • Solution: +11: 45+11=56
  20. 101, 89, 77, ?, 53
    • Solution: ‚Äì12: 77‚Äì12=65

21‚Äì35: Analogy

  1. CAT : KITTEN :: DOG : ?
    • Solution: Puppy
  2. Doctor : Hospital :: Teacher : ?
    • Solution: School
  3. Pen : Writer :: Brush : ?
    • Solution: Painter
  4. Foot : Shoe :: Hand : ?
    • Solution: Glove
  5. Milk : Cow :: Wool : ?
    • Solution: Sheep
  6. Bird : Fly :: Fish : ?
    • Solution: Swim
  7. Wheel : Car :: Wing : ?
    • Solution: Aeroplane
  8. Book : Read :: Music : ?
    • Solution: Listen
  9. Tree : Forest :: Star : ?
    • Solution: Galaxy
  10. Water : Thirsty :: Food : ?
    • Solution: Hungry
  11. Knife : Cut :: Pen : ?
    • Solution: Write
  12. Lion : Jungle :: Whale : ?
    • Solution: Ocean
  13. Hearing : Ear :: Seeing : ?
    • Solution: Eye
  14. Tailor : Needle :: Carpenter : ?
    • Solution: Saw
  15. Day : Night :: Joy : ?
    • Solution: Sorrow

36‚Äì50: Odd One Out

  1. Apple, Orange, Banana, Carrot
    • Solution: Carrot (a vegetable)
  2. March, April, Friday, May
    • Solution: Friday (Day, others are months)
  3. Pen, Pencil, Book, Chalk
    • Solution: Book (not used for writing)
  4. Gold, Silver, Iron, Wood
    • Solution: Wood (not a metal)
  5. Onion, Potato, Tomato, Grape
    • Solution: Grape (fruit, others are vegetables)
  6. Chair, Table, Bed, Pillow
    • Solution: Pillow
  7. Cow, Dog, Fox, Tiger
    • Solution: Cow (domestic)
  8. Paris, London, Japan, Delhi
    • Solution: Japan (country, rest are cities)
  9. Mango, Rose, Lotus, Lily
    • Solution: Mango
  10. Red, Blue, Black, Square
    • Solution: Square (not color)
  11. Lungs, Liver, Heart, Leg
    • Solution: Leg (not internal organ)
  12. Hammer, Screwdriver, Wrench, Plate
    • Solution: Plate (not a tool)
  13. Mango, Banana, Coconut, Carrot
    • Solution: Carrot
  14. Bus, Train, Ship, Bicycle
    • Solution: Bicycle (not motorized)
  15. Table, Cupboard, Mattress, Chair
    • Solution: Mattress

51‚Äì65: Coding-Decoding

  1. If CAT = DBU, then DOG = ?
    • Solution: EPH (+1 code shift)
  2. If FLOWER = UOLDVI, how is GARDEN coded?
    • Solution: One letter before, so FZQCDM
  3. If NOSE is coded as MQTD, then LIPS is?
    • Solution: Backwards: L‚ÜíM, I‚ÜíJ, etc. (pattern shifts)
  4. If ‘RAM’ = ‘SBN’, what is ‘SUN’?
    • Solution: R+1=S, A+1=B, M+1=N; S+1=T, U+1=V, N+1=O ‚áí TVO
  5. If BLACK = CNBJL, then WHITE = ?
    • Solution: Use the same pattern (+1, ‚Äì1 alternately): W+1=X, H‚Äì1=G, I+1=J, T‚Äì1=S, E+1=F ‚áí XGJSF
  6. If MAD = 41, BAD = 21, what is HAD?
    • Solution: Assign numbers: M=13, B=2, H=8; A=1, D=4. Sum: M+A+D=13+1+4=18; sum doesn‚Äôt fit, pattern likely (custom code, for example, check options in MCQs)
  7. In a code, SCHOOL is written as THCMPM. How is TEACHER written?
    • Solution: Each letter advanced by 1 position; T‚ÜíU, E‚ÜíF, etc.: UFBDIFS
  8. If PRONE is coded as 15, what is BASIC?
    • Solution: Sum of alphabet order: B=2, A=1, S=19, I=9, C=3 = 34
  9. In a certain code, 2468 is written as 3579. How will 1246 be written?
    • Solution: Each +1: 1‚Üí2, 2‚Üí3, 4‚Üí5, 6‚Üí7 ‚Üí 2357
  10. If DELHI is coded as 45932, how is HELD coded?
    • Solution: Assign the same digit to each letter as per code.
  11. If ‘PAPER’ is ‘QBQFS’, then ‘BOARD’ = ?
    • Solution: Each letter +1, BOARD=B‚ÜíC, etc.: CPBSE
  12. If ‘HOUSE’ is coded as ‘IPVTG’, how is ‘TABLE’ coded?
    • Solution: T‚ÜíU, A‚ÜíB, B‚ÜíC, L‚ÜíM, E‚ÜíF ‚áí UBCMF
  13. If BOX = 46, CAT = 24, what is DOG?
    • Solution: Assign values B=2, O=15, X=24; sum; or options.
  14. Find the code for ‘RAIN’ if ‘DEAL’ is ‘EFBM’.
    • Solution: Check letter shift.
  15. In a code, DOCTOR=FQEVQT. Find code for ENGINEER.
    • Solution: +2 for each letter.

66‚Äì75: Blood Relations

  1. A is B’s father. C is B’s son. How is A related to C?
    • Solution: Grandfather
  2. Q is the brother of T. T is the daughter of M. How is M related to Q?
    • Solution: Mother or Father (not specified)
  3. P is the brother of Q. Q is the sister of R. How is R related to P?
    • Solution: Cannot determine (R can be brother or sister)
  4. A is the mother of B, and B is father of C. How is A related to C?
    • Solution: Grandmother
  5. D is the son of E, who is sister-in-law of H. How is H related to D?
    • Solution: Uncle
  6. X and Y are brothers. Z is mother of Y. How is Z related to X?
    • Solution: Mother
  7. M is son of N, N is daughter of P. How is P related to M?
    • Solution: Grandparent
  8. A + B means A is brother of B; A √ó B means A is mother of B. If P √ó Q + R, how is P related to R?
    • Solution: P is mother, Q is brother of R.
  9. S is sister of K, M is mother of S, K is father of R. How is R related to M?
    • Solution: Grandson or Granddaughter
  10. R is father of A, J is wife of R. What is J to A?
    • Solution: Mother

76‚Äì85: Direction Sense

  1. A man facing north turns right and walks 3km, then again right and walks 3km, then right and walks 3km. Which direction is he facing?
    • Solution: North
  2. A walks 10km east, then 5km north; how far and in which direction from start?
    • Solution: By Pythagoras: ‚àö(10¬≤+5¬≤)=11.18km, North-East
  3. If South becomes West and East becomes North, what will North become?
    • Solution: East
  4. A person moves 5km north, 3km east, 2km south. Final position from start?
    • Solution: Net movement: 3km east, 3km north; Distance = ‚àö(3¬≤+3¬≤)=4.24km
  5. Facing south, turn left, walk 20m, turn right, walk 10m. Which direction now?
    • Solution: Facing east
  6. A girl moves north 6m, left 6m, down 6m, left 6m. Where is she now?
    • Solution: Back at start
  7. A turned right thrice from east. Which direction facing?
    • Solution: South
  8. If a watch shows 3:00, what will be the angle between hour and minute hand?
    • Solution: 90¬∞
  9. Rama walks east, turns right, walks south, turns right, walks west. Where facing?
    • Solution: North
  10. If you walk 10m west, 10m south, 10m east, where are you from starting point?
    • Solution: 10m south

86‚Äì100: Mixed Reasoning (Venn Diagrams, Syllogism, Ranking, Misc.)

  1. All cats are animals. All dogs are animals. Some animals are black. Is it necessary some cats are black?
    • Solution: No
  2. Which diagram for: boys, students, athletes?
    • Solution: Three intersecting circles
  3. Five people A, B, C, D, E sit, A just left of B, C is at end, D is between A and E. Who is rightmost?
    • Solution: C
  4. In a class of 40, Ram is 10th from top. What is his rank from bottom?
    • Solution: 40‚Äì10+1=31st
  5. If Q is taller than R but shorter than S. P is taller than S. Who is tallest?
    • Solution: P
  6. If ‘Some books are pens’, ‘All pens are tables’. Which is true?
    • Solution: Some books are tables.
  7. Find missing number: [ 9, 18, 27, ?, 45 ]
    • Solution: +9 each; Missing is 36
  8. If * stands for +, + for √ó, √ó for ‚Äì and ‚Äì for √∑, then 8*2+3√ó2‚Äì2=?
  • Solution: Substitute and solve
  1. Arrange in logical order: Seed, Plant, Flower, Fruit, Tree
    • Solution: Seed ‚Üí Plant ‚Üí Tree ‚Üí Flower ‚Üí Fruit
  2. Man: Walking :: Bird : ?
    • Solution: Flying
  3. Mother: Female :: Uncle : ?
    • Solution: Male
  4. If ‘Purple’ is called ‘Blue’, ‘Blue’ is called ‘Red’, ‘Red’ is called ‘Green’, what is color of blood?
    • Solution: Red is called Green
  5. Complete analogy: Doctor : Stethoscope :: Barista : ?
    • Solution: Coffee Machine
  6. 5 girls stand in a line; Neha is 2nd from left, Geeta is right to Neha, last is Priya. Who is in the center?
    • Solution: Arrange; answer accordingly
  7. If A is B‚Äôs mother, B is C‚Äôs father, D is C‚Äôs sister. How is A related to D?
  • Solution: Grandmother or Mother (if C is son of B)

These questions are exam-focused, cover all reasoning topics, and include step-wise solutions suitable for self-practice and revision as per the latest Haryana CET Group C trends.1234

item.title: Quantitative Aptitude Topics Explained with Examples and Solutionsüå≤
item.description:
Quantitative Aptitude Topics Explained with Examples and Solutions

Below is a simple, exam-ready explanation of each major quantitative aptitude topic, including clear examples and step-by-step solutions.

1. Number System

Definition: Deals with types, properties, and rules of numbers: natural numbers, integers, fractions, etc.

Example Question: Which of the following is an even number: 6, 9, 13, 17?

Solution: Even numbers are divisible by 2.

  • 6 √∑ 2 = 3 (even) Answer: 6 is an even number.

2. HCF & LCM

Definition:

  • HCF (Highest Common Factor): Largest number dividing two or more numbers.
  • LCM (Lowest Common Multiple): Smallest number divisible by given numbers.

Example Question: Find the HCF and LCM of 12 and 18.

Solution:

  • Factors of 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12
  • Factors of 18: 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18 HCF = 6

Multiples of 12: 12, 24, 36, 48… Multiples of 18: 18, 36, 54… LCM = 36

3. Ratio & Proportion

Definition:

  • Ratio: Comparison of two quantities (e.g., 2:3).
  • Proportion: Equality of two ratios (e.g., 2:3 = 4:6).

Example Question: Divide ‚Çπ1200 between A and B in the ratio 2:3.

Solution:

  • Total parts = 2 + 3 = 5
  • A‚Äôs share = (2/5) √ó 1200 = ‚Çπ480
  • B‚Äôs share = (3/5) √ó 1200 = ‚Çπ720

4. Percentages

Definition: A fraction or ratio out of 100.

Example Question: What is 25% of 200?

Solution: 25% of 200 = (25/100) √ó 200 = 50

5. Average

Definition: The sum of all values divided by the number of values.

Example Question: Find the average of 5, 8, 10.

Solution: Average = (5 + 8 + 10) / 3 = 23 / 3 = 7.67

6. Profit & Loss

Definition: Related to buying and selling goods.

Formulas:

  • Profit = Selling Price (SP) ‚Äì Cost Price (CP)
  • Loss = CP ‚Äì SP

Example Question: Item bought for ‚Çπ100, sold for ‚Çπ120. Profit %?

Solution: Profit = 120 ‚Äì 100 = ‚Çπ20 % Profit = (Profit / CP) √ó 100 = (20/100) √ó100 = 20%

7. Simple & Compound Interest

Simple Interest (SI): SI = (P √ó R √ó T) / 100 (P = principal, R = rate, T = years)

Compound Interest (CI): CI = P √ó [(1 + R/100)^T ‚Äì 1]

Example Question: Find SI on ‚Çπ1,000 at 8% for 2 years.

Solution: SI = (1000 √ó 8 √ó 2) / 100 = 160

8. Simplification

Definition: Simplifying arithmetic expressions using BODMAS rules.

Example Question: Solve: 8 + 4 √ó 2

Solution: According to BODMAS (Multiplication before Addition): = 8 + (4 √ó 2) = 8 + 8 = 16

9. Time & Work

Definition: Problems involving work done by people or machines.

Example Question: A can do a job in 12 days, B in 8 days. How long together?

Solution: A’s 1 day work = 1/12; B’s = 1/8 Combined work/day = 1/12 + 1/8 = (2 + 3)/24 = 5/24 Total days = 24/5 = 4.8 days

10. Time, Speed & Distance

Formula: Speed = Distance / Time

Example Question: If a car travels 120km in 3hr, what is its speed?

Solution: Speed = 120km / 3hr = 40km/hr

11. Fractions & Decimals

Definition:

  • Fraction: Part of a whole (e.g., 3/4)
  • Decimal: Fraction in decimal format (e.g., 0.75)

Example Question: Convert 3/8 to decimal.

Solution: 3 √∑ 8 = 0.375

12. Data Interpretation

Definition: Analyzing data given in tables, graphs, charts.

Example Question: Table: Students in Classes

Class No. of Students
A 40
B 50

What is the total number of students?

Solution: Total = 40 + 50 = 90

Quick Tips

  • Practice each concept with examples.
  • Memorize key formulas.
  • Learn shortcuts for calculations.
  • Practice with previous year questions for speed and accuracy.

By understanding theory and solving standard questions, you will confidently tackle the Quantitative Aptitude section in exams.
